case_vignette: A 26-year-old man is brought to the emergency department by his wife because of bizarre and agitated behavior for the last 6 weeks. He thinks that the NSA is spying on him and controlling his mind. His wife reports that the patient has become withdrawn and at times depressed for the past 3 months. He lost his job because he stopped going to work 4 weeks ago. Since then, he has been working on an invention that will block people from being able to control his mind. Physical and neurologic examinations show no abnormalities. On mental status examination, he is confused and suspicious with marked psychomotor agitation. His speech is disorganized and his affect is labile.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling really agitated and I think someone is spying on me and controlling my thoughts.
Have you experienced similar feelings or thoughts in the past?
No, this has been happening for the last 6 weeks.
Are you currently taking any medications or substances, including alcohol or drugs?
The case vignette does not mention me taking any medications or substances.
Do you have any previous medical or psychiatric history?
The case vignette does not provide information about my previous medical or psychiatric history.
Have these feelings impacted your daily life or relationships with others?
Yes, I've become withdrawn, stopped going to work, and have been preoccupied with an invention to block mind control.
Do you have any family members with psychiatric conditions such as schizophrenia or bipolar disorder?
The case vignette does not provide information about my family history.
How old are you and what is your gender?
I'm a 26-year-old man.
**Final Diagnosis:** Paranoid Schizophrenia.
